description: 1972 Jaguar XKE V12 Roadster

It comes equipped with an automatic transmission, air conditioning, OEM radio, power steering, rear luggage rack, wire wheels, soft top and includes the jack and spare tire. An extremely clean and presentable example which is highly collectible and mechanically sound.
For $64,500 USD

This 1967 Jaguar XKE Series I Coupe. Burgundy with cream interior. Only 51K original miles from new. It was pampered by it's previous owner. It's a matching numbers car. Excellent and a very honest original car. IT's the last and most collectible year for Series I two seater coups. It also has very desirable covered headlights. For only $89,500.

Jaguar 1973 XKE, 12-cylinder, low mileage, always stored, needs some bodywork, but basically very sound! $50,000; parts available: XKE hood, sound; XKE factory wire wheels, set of four. 561-588-7868, FL.
1973 JAGUAR E-TYPE 5.2 SERIES 3 CONVERTIBLE

THE JAGJUAR E-TYPE WAS INTRODUCED TO THE PUBLIC IN 1961 AND CONTINUED IN SEVERAL VARIANTS UNTIL 1975. IT WAS INITIALLY SHOWN AS A TWO SEATER FIXED HEAD COUPE AND ALSO AS A TWO SEATER CONVERTIBLE. THE LATTER MODEL BECAME KNOWN AS A ROADSTER AND WAS BY FAR THE MOST POPULAR OF THE MODELS THAT JAGUAR MANUFACTURED AT THE TIME. IN 1971 THROUGH 1974 JAGUAR INTRODUCED THE SERIES THREE CARS WHICH FEATURED A 5.3 LITRE V12 ENGINE AND EITHER A 3 SPEED AUTOMATIC OR 4 SPEED MANUAL GEARBOX. THE CAR CAME IN BOTH COUPE AND CONVERTIBLE VERSIONS. INTERIOR COKCPIT SPACE WAS INCREASED BY EXTENDING THE VEHICLE WHEELBASE. ASIDE FROM EXTRA LEGROOM FOR FRONT SEAT OCCUPANTS THE DRIVER'S FOOTWELL WAS ALSO ENLARGED OFFERING GREATER COMFORT.

THE CAR WE ARE OFFERING IS A TWO OWNER CAR WHICH WAS BOUGHT BY THE PRESENT OWNER 8 YEARS AGO AND IN THAT TIME HAS ONLY ACCUMULATED TWO THOUSAND MILES (THIS OWNER ALSO HAS A SECOND XKE SHARING HIS GARAGE). TOTAL MILEAGE SINCE NEW IS 20,003.

THE CAR IS PAINTED BRG AND HAS A BLACK LEATHER INTERIOR. ORIGINAL 4 SPEED MANUAL TRANSMISSION AND AIR CONDITIONING. THE CAR IS FITTED WITH THE EARLIER THIN BUMPERS WITH OVER-RIDERS FRONT AND REAR, IMPROVING THE CAR'S GREAT OVERALL APPEARANCE.

THE CAR HAS BEEN ROUTINELY SERVICED WITHOUT REGARD TO COST. IN ADDITION TO REGULAR MAINTENANCE THE SEATS HAVE BEEN RE-COVERED, A NEW SOFT TOP FITTED, AND THE TRUNK RE-TRIMMED. A BOOT COVER FOR THE SOFT TOP IS ALSO INCLUDED.  PRICED AT $105,000.00
1973 JAGUAR E
This 1967 Jaguar XKE Coupe is an excellent original matching numbers Series I car for straightforward restoration. Burgundy with black interior. A great buy at just $56,500

In 1961 the Jaguar XKE was introduced to the world and has since been considered one of the most beautiful motorcars ever created. Even Enzo Ferrari admitted that it was one of the most beautiful cars that he had ever seen. Of all the E-Types the first of its kind, the Series 1 cars, are the most sought after version of the historic E-Type cars with their “small mouth nose” and early style taillights located above the rear bumpers which were produced through 1968. Beginning with a 3.8 Liter twin cam 6 cylinder engine carried over from the XK150 3.8 S cars, in 1964 Jaguar decided to enlarge the displacement of their bulletproof twin cam six to 4.2 liters which was to be used until the end of the Series 2 car production. Like many other cars, certain years become a transitional period where a later design is merged with an earlier one, sometimes resulting in a car that has the best attributes of both designs, which brings us to the 1968 XKE. 1968 was the last year for the Series 1 and because of this it was the most refined version. Still retaining the bodylines of a series 1, but adding the upgraded Stromberg carburetors from the outdated SU's, adding the more modern rocker switches on the dash replacing the toggle switches and beginning half way through the 1967 model year, the covers on the headlights were removed for better visibility at night. Overall the 1968 model year is the most refined version of the legendary Series 1 offering the looks of the Series 1 and the best upgrades of the Series 2.

This 1968 Series 1 OTS is a wonderful example having just 30,000 original miles since new and having just two owners since 1968. Complete with its original hardtop and a Jaguar heritage certificate, this car is finished in its original color of primrose yellow with a black leather interior just as it left the factory. The paint, chrome and upholstery are all in wonderful condition showing that that this car was very well cared for over its life. The matching numbers engine runs wonderfully well and can be driven and enjoyed without worry. The body shows no signs of ever having rust or patch work which really solidifies the cars low original mileage. This is a beautiful low mileage Series 1 XKE OTS that has been well cared for over the years and is ready to be a part of a great sports car collection or to be driven and enjoyed for years to come.

1969 Jaguar XKE CoupeIt has been said many times before but it is always worth repeating, Enzo Ferrari when he saw the first Jaguar XKE was quote in all the newspapers and magazines as saying, "THE MOST BEAUTIFUL CAR EVER MADE".One of our favorite configurations for an XKE in terms of aesthetics is the XKE coupe, the sloping roof line just adds that little bit of extra to the total design of the XKE to truly make it one of the most beautiful sports car designs ever executed.  The second thought in reference to the car in this ad is that color is always very important and XKE's in cream just have a certain amount of extra "POP"!   As you can see from the photos of this 1969 Jaguar XKE coupe that is listed it is strikingly beautiful. It is interesting to note that a previous owner who appears to have had much experience with the early XKE's with their 3.8 engines, decided that while he loved the lines of his 1969 Jaguar coupe, he much preferred the early 3.8 engines to the six cylinder engines that were factory installed in the 1969 Jaguars.  With that in mind he proceeded to replace the 4.2 engine with a 3.8 engine.  The current owner has had the engine super detailed.  It is our understanding from the private seller that the 3.8 engine has under 500 miles since 1988.  Actual mileage unknown.The current owner has driven this car on trips up to about 50 miles and has indicated that it drives just as it should. The manual transmission operates as it should.The cream paint is complimented by the red leather interior. The current owner would like to make note that the radio is currently not working and he believes that it is not the original radio. The 1969 Jaguar XKE coupe in this listing has been fully detailed with all engine and body parts cleaned.  Take a look at the photos to see how exceptionally well that the car does show. The current owner describes the appearance of this car as a beautiful driver but certainly not a trailer queen. Considering how the XKE's have been escalating in price, the reserve is very conservative and you can certainly feel free to bid to win and be happy that you did.

*1974 is the LAST year of the Jaguar E-Type. This is an exceptional example of a HIGHLY COLLECTIBLE Jaguar E-Type. Always garage kept, very well maintained and mechanically sound.  The 12-cylinder engine runs smooth and the transmission shifts smoothly through the gears. The car drives exactly as it should new. The Series III Jaguar has a longer wheelbase, which makes it a more comfortable overall driver experience from earlier models. This car is an absolute blast to drive with the top up or down.

Legend has it that when it went on display for the first time at the Geneva Motor Show, none other than Enzo Ferrari remarked that the E-Type was the most beautiful car he'd ever seen.  Mr. Ferrari knew a pretty car when he saw one and he might have been one of the first to express the sentiment, but an incalculable number of others have said virtually the same thing and they're still saying it fifty years later. This is one of the most beautiful cars in history. A noted aerodynamicist, Malcolm Sayer, designed the Jaguar E-Type. The E-Type was meant to cheat the wind, but its glass covered headlights, long hood, short rear deck and compound curves also coincidentally looked great.

This color combination shows so well for the Jaguar E-Type. Paint is in great shape. Body-lines all align nicely. Owners manual. Air conditioning and power steering. Tools and jack set. Car has always been serviced by Mel's Auto Repair (Jaguar Specialist) here in California. She is ready for a new home and tons of enjoyment for the new owners.
Best of Class 1st Place Jaguar E-Type Winner on October 1, 2006 at San Diego British Car Day

1972 JAGUAR XKE E-TYPE 2+2 for sale. Motorcar Classics is pleased to present this delightful 1972 Jaguar XKE 2+2 featured in Silver Metallic with Black leather interior. This fine E-Type Series 3 sports Jaguars new 5.3L twelve- cylinder V12 engine, uprated brakes and power steering. It has the desirable 4-Speed manual gearbox with factory optional chrome wire wheels and air conditioning. Jaguars V12 engine was originally developed for the 24 Hours of Le Mans. It was equipped with four Zenith carburettors. It is claimed to produce 272 hp, with more torque, and a 0-60 mph acceleration of less than 7 seconds. Our car is a high-level driver quality car that has one quality respray with excellent leather and interior. It looks, runs and drives excellent. This elegant 2+2 is spacious and usable and represents excellent value in a collectible E-Type.

Now for sale in our Houston Showroom is this beautiful 1971 Jaguar XKE. This cars combination of beauty high performance and competitive pricing established the model as an icon of the motoring world. This car is estimated to be a sub 7 second car for the 0-60 and makes for a nice fun ride. In 2004 the E-Type was listed the number one sports car of the 60"??s. This XKE features the original 5.3L V12 that runs very strong and shifts smoothly through the 3-speed automatic transmission. The engine was rebuilt 30000 miles ago by the original owner and can"??t wait to have more added to it. This car also features power steering and power brakes to make for a nice driver whenever you want to just take a drive along the coast. The exterior paint is a very clean Wimbledon White that is in great condition. You"??ll find that the chrome accents bumpers and lights are all in great condition as well. The car also features a nice set of drilled and slotted disk brakes on the front of the car. The wire wheels are in great condition and go very well with the thin white wall tires. The tires might I add are in like new condition to provide for several miles of cruising left in them. The interior of the car is in great condition for a 46-year-old vehicle. The originality of the car is something to take notice of on this beauty. Looking throughout the interior you will see the door paneling dash gauges seats and even headliner remain in great condition. This car would be great in anyones garage and is worth seeing in person. To see all the HD pictures and video please go to http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/HOU/1112/1971-jaguar-xke.
